There are many unique challenges you may be facing during the Coronavirus epidemic. You may feel differently than you normally do. The good news is there are steps you can take, resources you can discover and people you can reach out to who can help you feel better.

Throughout this site, you’ll find information and resources compiled by the Indiana Division of Mental Health and Addiction designed to help Hoosiers stay connected and maintain their well-being. These resources have been validated by local and national experts to ensure that you have access to reliable information that you can trust.

post_text: BOOKWORM COMES TO SHOALS! We are very excited that Shoals Elementary is the only elementary school in southern Indiana and only 1 out of 4 in Indiana that has a Bookworm vending machine. The Bookworm machine is a vending machine that vends books to help promote literacy. Books can only be purchased using special tokens that students can earn by showing unique characteristics such as responsibility, kindness, perseverance, empathy, and creativity. The books are being purchased with money received from a generous anonymous donor. Over the next school year, if each elementary staff member gives out 1 coin a week, we will have placed 1,000 brand new books in the hands of our students at Shoals Elementary. If you are interested in donating, please call the Elementary office or Julia Sanders in the Elementary Library.

We are very proud of Alex Tedrow who is now at the Indiana University's Jacobs School of Music. One of the best in the country! He composed his own piece of music about our hometown. Way to go Alex!

He wrote, "My mission for this piece was to do something that would bring more attention to the neat features of this town. I decided to single out nine locations in Shoals where I have had the most meaningful memories. The music embodies the moods, ideas, and experiences these locations have given me after years of exploring them. Some of this material was even composed while visiting the places in the piece. Many similar themes and motivic ideas carry across movements throughout the work. I chose to compose Remnants of Shoals for clarinet choir because I feel the sound of a clarinet effectively represents the simplicity of life in such a small rural town. Pictures of the locations featured in this piece can be viewed at the web link tedrowa.wixsite.com/remnants."
